what: What’s the scenario this R package is tailored for?
title: An R package pipelining binary classification of survival
text: patroklos good choice just mentioned scenario good choice scenario tailored . Imagine given data set holding information cancer patients. data includes many, many features high-throughput measurement like gene-expression levels hundreds even thousands genes (“expression data”) features (“pheno data”). Among pheno data survival information form time event right censoring. want build binary classifier takes subset features (excluding two survival features) input predict given sample faces event (like progression death) certain time. tasks involves preprocessing data, deciding error measure validation testing, training whole bunch models validating , including tuning hyperparameters, assessing best validated model test cohort unlocking test set trained models analysis, e.g., reliably cross-validated errors estimate test error. point sequence, boss may come new ideas: training new model, training models different data set, testing models different test set changing error measure validation. boss machine learning project , , need flexible able integrate new ideas quickly. may hire secretary. resort patroklos. patroklos big part repetitive, administrative work lets focus statistical biological part work. still bureaucratic work left , patroklos least tells . , patroklos star shows. plays key role — just like Πάτροκλος Iliad: Achilles’ best friend, death brings Achilles back battlefield helping Greeks score decisive victories.

text: patroklos abstracts data models, specify another R6 class, Model. model typically specifies just one combination hyperparameters need tuned. Concerning model classes fitting functions, full flexibility — can provide fitting function attribute Model long function interface fulfills patroklos’s expectations: see documentation Models fitter attribute. fitting function generates hyperparameters automatically tunes hyperparameters internally, ’s totally fine long returns single fit object validated predictions predict method. , left 100% model calculates validated predictions, e.g. cross validation --bag predictions. patroklos also provides patroklos-compliant fitting functions box, namely Gauss, logistic Cox models means zeroSum package random forests means ranger package. every Model, patroklos can tune model-agnostic hyperparameters .

title: An R package pipelining binary classification of survival
text: Validate models training data test test data variety metrics including (scalar) error measures — precision (constraint minimum rate positive predictions .k.prevalence), hazard ratio, ROC-AUC, lower upper bound γ\gamma-confidence interval precision hazard ratio — R6 classes AssScalar. many models first need threshold output binary classifier hand. R6 class Ass2d, , every possible threshold, plots one metric binary classifier another — e.g. prevalence precision — guides thresholding. testing, often want compare picked model benchmark model — problem, just include output data specify Model help projection_on_feature() fitter. #### Meta analysis testing picked model test cohort, unlock models, plot validation versus test error, group models hyperparameters find hyperparameters come systematic flaws validation notoriously high test errors. Exclude problematic models set Models future. val_vs_test() friend .

title: An R6 class to assess a model with continuous output with one metric versus another. — Ass2d
code: Ass2d$new(   x_metric,   y_metric,   ci_level = 0.95,   x_lab = NULL,   y_lab = NULL,   xlim = c(-Inf, Inf),   ylim = c(-Inf, Inf),   scale_x = "identity",   scale_y = "identity",   alpha = 1,   colors = NULL,   theme = ggplot2::theme_minimal(),   width = 7,   height = 4,   units = "in",   dpi = 300 )

title: An R6 class to assess a model with continuous output with one metric versus another. — Ass2d
text: x_metric, y_metric string. Metric shown x y axis. Regarding choices: Every combination (measure, x.measure) one can pass ROCR::performance(). y_metric "logrank" "precision_ci" (upper limit ci_level confidence interval precision, see ), x_metric must "prevalence" "rpp" (rate positive predictions). (x_metric, y_metric) = ("rank", "risk score"), plot rank every risk score agaisnt risk score color true risk. ci_level numeric [0, 1]. level used calculate confidence intervals. x_lab, y_lab string. Axis labels. Default x_metric y_metric, respectively. xlim, ylim numeric vector length 2. limits axes. Default contraints. scale_x, scale_y string transformation object (see scales::trans_new latter). scale axes, pass trans paramter ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(), ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(), respectively. alpha numeric [0, 1]. alpha value points lines plot. colors character vector. colors used different models. Default NULL, means default colors ggplot2 used. theme S3 object inheriting "theme" "gg" (typically return value ggplot2::theme() complete ggplot2 theme like ggplot2::theme_light()). theme plot. Default ggplot2::theme_minimal(). width numeric. width plot units. height numeric. height plot units. units string. units width height. Default "" (inches). dpi numeric. Plot resolution dots per inch.

text: metrics Assess model scalar metrics. Check initializer possible choices. prev_range metrics need thresholding consider thresholds yield prevalence range. confidence_level Confidence level alpha. benchmark Incorporate benchmark assessment. round_digits Round results tables round_digits digits point. file Save resulting tibble csv file.

title: An R6 class to assess a model with a scalar metric — AssScalar
code: AssScalar$new(   metrics = c("auc", "accuracy", "precision", "prevalence", "precision_ci_ll",     "precision_ci_ul", "hr", "hr_ci_ll", "hr_ci_ul", "hr_p", "n_true", "perc_true",     "n_samples", "logrank", "threshold"),   prev_range = c(0, 1),   confidence_level = 0.95,   benchmark = NULL,   file = NULL,   round_digits = 3 )

title: An R6 class to assess a model with a scalar metric — AssScalar
text: metrics character. Assess model metrics. currently offered choices see "Usage" . model non-binary output (like logistic regression), choose threshold maximizing left-metric metrics made classifiers binary output (e.g. precision within prev_range ). done reasonably, throw error. Make sure hr precedes hr_ci_ll, hr_ci_ul hr_p metrics; precision_ci_ll must precede precision_ci_ul. prev_range numeric numeric vector length 2. metrics need thresholding consider thresholds yield prevalence range. confidence_level numeric. confidence level alpha (e.g. confidence intervals). benchmark list NULL. NULL, list element names c("name",  prev_rage"): name refers name benchmark model model_list, prev_range special value parameter benchmark model. Often, need higher prevalence , new models gain statistical power able significantly outperform benchmark. file string NULL. name csv file save results train cohort. results saved. round_digits numeric. number digits round results . Default 3.

text: name refer data plots messages. directory Directory expression pheno csv files lie. expr_mat expression matrix. pheno_tbl phenotype tibble. expr_file Name expression csv file inside directory. pheno_file Name pheno data csv inside directory. cohort cohort data, train test. cohort_col Find cohort sample column pheno data. patient_id_col name column pheno data holds patient identifiers. time_to_event_col name column pheno data holds time--event values. event_col name column pheno data holds event status encoded 1 = occurrence, 0 = censoring. benchmark_col name column pheno data holds benchmark risk score (like IPI). gene_id_col name column expression data holds gene identifiers. pivot_time_cutoff Pivotal time cutoff analysis assessment. imputer Function handling NAs predictor matrix.

code: Data$new(   name,   directory,   pivot_time_cutoff,   time_to_event_col,   cohort,   event_col = "progression",   cohort_col = "split_1",   benchmark_col = NULL,   expr_file = "expr.csv",   pheno_file = "pheno.csv",   patient_id_col = "patient_id",   gene_id_col = "gene_id",   imputer = mean_impute )

title: An R6 class for the data — Data
text: name string. telling name data set (e.g. "Schmitz et al. 2018"). directory string. directory expression pheno csv files lie. pivot_time_cutoff numeric. Pivotal time cutoff analysis. time_to_event_col string. name column pheno data holds time--event values. cohort string. end preparing data, subset samples whose value cohort_col column matches cohort. event_col string. name column pheno data holds event status encoded 1 = occurrence, 0 = censoring. cohort_col string. name column pheno data holds cohort sample belongs . benchmark_col string NULL. name column pheno data holds benchmark risk score (like IPI). expr_file string. name expression csv file inside directory. Default "expr.csv". See details expected format. pheno_file string. name pheno data csv inside directory. Default "pheno.csv". See details expected format. patient_id_col string. name column pheno data holds patient identifiers. gene_id_col string. name column expression data holds gene identifiers. imputer function NULL. Function handling NAs predictor matrix. takes single argument x, predictor matrix, numeric categorical variables dichotomized binary dummy variables, returns matrix shape non-NAs left untouched. Default mean_impute(). NULL means imputation (applying identity function x).

title: An R6 class for the data — Data
text: pheno csv file holds samples rows (unique sample ids first (character) column called patient_id_col), variables columns. expression csv file holds genes rows (unique gene ids first (character) column called gene_id_col), samples columns. computational representation expression pheno data change course pipeline, Data object hold timeless information data.

title: An R6 class for a model — Model
text: name telling name model. directory Store/find Model fit_obj set directory. fitter Fit validate model fitting function. time_cutoffs Threshold censor outcome accordingly. val_error_fun Calculates error validated predictions. hyperparams Optional arguments passed fitter. include_from_continuous_pheno names continuous variables pheno data () included predictor matrix. include_from_discrete_pheno names discrete variables pheno data () included predictor matrix. include_expr Whether include expression data predictor matrix. combine_n_max_categorical_features Maximum number categorical features combine. combined_feature_min_positive_ratio Minimum ratio positive observations combined (categorical) feature. enable_imputation Overrides imputer attribute Data object. fit_obj fitted object, something returned fitter like ptk_zerosum S3 object. create_directory Whether create directory exist, yet. file Store Model object name directory. li_var_suffix Append names features pheno data adding predictor matrix.

text: Model$new() Model$fit() Model$predict() Model$clone()

title: An R6 class for a model — Model
text: Create new Model instance.

title: An R6 class for a model — Model
code: Model$new(   name,   fitter,   directory,   time_cutoffs,   val_error_fun,   hyperparams = NULL,   include_from_continuous_pheno = NULL,   include_from_discrete_pheno = NULL,   include_expr = TRUE,   combine_n_max_categorical_features = 1L,   combined_feature_min_positive_ratio = 0.04,   enable_imputation = TRUE,   file = "model.rds",   create_directory = TRUE,   li_var_suffix = "++" )

title: An R6 class for a model — Model
text: name string. telling name model. fitter function. Fit model data validate fitting function. See fitter_prototype() required interface. patroklos provides two fitters box: ptk_zerosum(), wrapper around zeroSum::zeroSum ptk_ranger(), wrapper around ranger::ranger(). tune just one combination hyperparameters, decorate fitter hypertune(). directory string. Store/find Model fit_obj set directory. time_cutoffs numeric vector. model-agnostic hyperparameter changes response training follows: every value time_cutoffs, specify model following response data: Cox response, censor patients event occurred time_cutoffs value train specified model. binary response, binarize outcome depending whether occurred value. already tune hyperparameter store best model according validation fit_obj report chosen time cutoff time_cutoff attribute . val_error_fun Function used calculate error independently validated predictions. Must take two numeric vector equal length: y y_hat, true predicted outcomes, respectively, return numeric scalar; lower, better model. See error_rate() neg_roc_auc() examples. hyperparams list. Optional arguments passed fitter, e.g. alpha case elastic net. include_from_continuous_pheno vector strings. names continuous variables pheno data () included predictor matrix. Default NULL, means continuous pheno variables included. include_from_discrete_pheno vector strings. names discrete variables pheno data () included predictor matrix. discrete variable n levels dichotomized n-1 binary dummy variables. Default NULL, means discrete pheno variables included. include_expr logical. Whether include expression data predictor matrix. combine_n_max_categorical_features integer. Maximum number categorical features combine predicting features. combined_feature_min_positive_ratio numeric. Minimum ratio positive observations combined (categorical) feature. attribute together combine_n_max_categorical_features governs combined categorical features predictor matrix contain: add combination levels distinct categorical features predictor matrix imputation combine_n_max_categorical_features involved combination combination (expected ) least combined_feature_min_positive_ratio samples. enable_imputation logical. FALSE, overrides imputer attribute Data object impute. file string. name model-fit_obj file inside directory. Default "fit_obj.rds". create_directory logical. Whether create directory exist, yet. Default TRUE. li_var_suffix string. Append names features pheno data adding predictor matrix. Default "++".

code: greedy_nestor(x, y, val_error_fun, model1, fitter2, hyperparams2)

title: Nest an existing, tuned model together with more features into another model and tune the latter — greedy_nestor
text: x named numeric matrix (samples x features). Features meant late model exactly matching x's li_var_suffix attribute. y Named list entries "bin", named numeric one-column matrix, binary response used training, "cox", named numeric two-column matrix used training, time event event (0 = censoring, 1 = event) first second column, respectively. TRUE, interprete mtry relative sqrt(ncol(x)) (recommended value), rounded next integer. Otherwise, take mtry directly. mtry Number variables possibly split node. text: x data numeric matrix object (rows=samples). zero-sum regression requires data log scale, .e. x log-transformed data. y Named list entries "bin", named numeric one-column matrix, binary response used training, "cox", named numeric two-column matrix used training, time event event (0 = censoring, 1 = event) first second column, respectively. "true", named numeric one-column matrix, binary response used calculating CV error. val_error_fun Function used calculate error independently validated predictions. Must take two numeric vector equal length: y y_hat, true predicted outcomes, respectively, return numeric scalar; lower, better model. See error_rate() neg_roc_auc() examples. exclude_pheno_from_lasso Logical. TRUE, set LASSO penalty weights corresponding features pheno data zero. binarize_predictions numeric NULL. NULL, predict method returned ptk_zerosum object binarize predictions using binarize_predictions threshold. ... can used adjusting internal parameters nFold number folds used cross validation (Default 10) zeroSum.weights weights vector zero-sum constraint length ncol(x). setting weight 0 corresponding feature excluded zero-sum constraint. (must greater equal zero, default 1) penalty.factor weights vector elatic net regularization length ncol(x). setting weight 0 corresponding feature regularized thus part resulting model. (must greater equal zero, default 1). family choose regression type: gaussian: numeric response binomial:  multinomial:  cox: y matrix two columns, first must                 contain event time second indicating                  type: 1 = event occured, 0 = right censoring
